title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep-debt-tracker is a web-based project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML designed to help users track and manage their sleep debt. This repository showcases practical application of TypeScript within a front-end project focused on personal productivity and well-being.

title: resume
description: This repository contains the TeX source code for my resume, showcasing my skills and experience in a professionally typeset format. It serves as a project demonstrating proficiency in LaTeX and its application for creating polished documents. The repository offers a clear example of how to manage and maintain a resume using version control and markup languages.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript that implements a modern voting system. It focuses on providing a user-friendly and efficient platform for creating and participating in polls and elections. The repository contains the complete codebase for the application, encompassing both the front-end user interface and the underlying logic for managing votes and results.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project showcasing a responsive and interactive dashboard built using Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. It serves as a practical example for learning and implementing modern web development techniques with a focus on component-based architecture, type safety, and dynamic routing in a dashboard environment.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project exploring interactive map visualizations created using HTML for the front-end and Python for data processing and back-end tasks. This repository showcases techniques for displaying geographical data and building dynamic map interfaces, focusing on practical implementation and demonstration within the realm of mapping projects.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a project exploring a collaborative idea management platform. Built using TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, it aims to provide a user-friendly interface for brainstorming, organizing, and prioritizing ideas within a team or community, fostering innovation and effective project planning.

title: jovian
description: The `jovian` repository is a Python-based CRUD application built with Flask and PostgreSQL, demonstrating a practical project for managing data.  It utilizes HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting to create a functional web interface and handle server-side logic, covering topics such as application development, database interaction, and basic web design principles.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository provides a user-friendly interface for visualizing and interacting with data from the Robofleet robotic fleet management system. Built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS, this project offers real-time insights into robot status, tasks, and performance, enabling efficient monitoring and control of your robotic deployments. This dashboard focuses on providing a clear and concise view of key project metrics.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, JavaScript, and HTML using Vitejs and Expressjs to create a platform that leverages the Gemini API. This repository showcases a practical application of these technologies while exploring concepts related to API integration, modern web development, and project structuring with TypeScript.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built using Jupyter Notebook and Python, houses a collection of projects focused on applying Python to various finance-related tasks. It explores topics such as financial modeling, data analysis, portfolio optimization, and algorithmic trading, providing practical examples and insights into leveraging Python for financial analysis and decision-making.

This project, built using TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML, explores core concepts related to its primary topic: project management. It serves as a practical demonstration and exploration, leveraging web technologies to illustrate fundamental principles and potentially offer interactive tools or visual representations within the realm of project-related tasks.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: iot-asset-tracking is a Next.js project built with TypeScript, TailwindCSS, and Supabase for real-time tracking of IoT assets. This repository showcases a modern web application architecture utilizing a serverless database and a component-driven UI framework to provide a scalable and user-friendly solution for asset management and location monitoring.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: Dynamic-event-calendar is a project showcasing a responsive and interactive event calendar built using JavaScript, CSS, and HTML. This repository provides a practical example of implementing a dynamic calendar interface for displaying and managing events, focusing on front-end development techniques and practical web application design.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool designed to efficiently analyze and visualize ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. Built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting, this project provides a user-friendly interface for parsing, filtering, and presenting ROS log data, enabling developers to quickly identify and debug issues within their robotic systems. This project falls under the general topic of project, offering a valuable utility for the ROS community.
